title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: To test the potential of short- and medium-range enhancers to act over long genomic distances
outcome: we performed a series of enhancer-replacement experiments at the Shh genomic locus

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: To perform enhancer-replacement experiments
context: Owing to the clear phenotypic readout and lack of redundancy, ZRS-Shh is an ideal locus for assessing the long-range enhancer activity of transplanted enhancers
outcome: we selected four previously characterized developmental limb enhancers from other genomic loci on the basis of their ability to drive robust LacZ reporter expression in the developing limb bud mesenchyme (MM1492 and MM1564 (from mouse) and HS1516 and HS72 (from human); Fig. 1a,b)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: The HS72, HS1516 and MM1492 enhancers also drive LacZ reporter expression in the ZPA, a posterior domain of the limb mesenchyme where ZRS activates Shh gene expression (Fig. 1b)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: All four enhancers are evolutionarily conserved and marked by acetylation at lysine 27 in histone H3 (H3K27ac) in limb buds (Fig. 1a)
context: a histone modification that is associated with active enhancers
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: To determine the genomic distance at which these enhancers act on their native promoters and to ensure that they are accessible to transcription factors (TFs) in the same cell types as the ZRS
outcome: we performed single-nucleus assay for transposase-accessible chromatin with sequencing (snATAC–seq) and single-nucleus RNA sequencing (snRNA-seq) multiome profiling of 14,000 cells from a wild-type (WT) embryonic day 11.5 (E11.5) hindlimb bud (Methods)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: we annotated 16 clusters representing all major cell types in the developing limb bud (Methods, Extended Data Fig. 1 and Supplementary Table 1)
context: After clustering all 14,000 cells on the basis of their chromatin and gene expression profiles
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: The HS72, HS1516 and MM1492 enhancers display strong DNA accessibility in Shh positive ZPA cells (Fig. 1a)
context: consistent with their ability to drive robust reporter expression in posterior limb mesenchyme in transgenic mouse embryos
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: To link limb enhancers to their putative target genes
outcome: we used the correlation between gene expression and open chromatin peaks from multiome profiling and E–P physical interaction data based on tissue-resolved high-resolution enhancer-capture Hi-C experiments (Methods)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: We identified Prdm16 as the target for MM1492 (73 kb away), Ets2 as the target for mHS1516 (mouse homologue of HS1516) (147 kb away) and Sall1 as the target for mHS72 (mouse homologue of HS72) (411 kb away) (Fig. 1c)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: (missing)
outcome: We then manually matched enhancer activity and the expression patterns of genes located within the same TADs in E11.5 mouse embryos

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: This analysis confirmed the above E–P links and additionally identified Rbms1 as a putative target for MM1564 (177 kb away; Fig. 1b,c)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: (missing)
outcome: We next used genome editing to create a series of knock-in (KI) mice in which the functionally critical 1.3-kb region of the ZRS (Fig. 1d and Extended Data Fig. 2a,b) was replaced with selected limb bud enhancers from other genomic loci

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: replacing the mouse ZRS with HS72, MM1564, HS1516 or MM1492 limb enhancers resulted in a loss of detectable Shh expression in the limb bud (Fig. 1e)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: To assess the extent to which replacing the ZRS with a heterologous limb enhancer affects in vivo development
outcome: we examined the skeletal morphology in E18.5 KI mice

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: all four KI mouse strains displayed a truncated limb phenotype affecting both the forelimbs and hindlimbs
context: Consistent with the loss of limb-specific Shh expression
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: The limb phenotypes were indistinguishable from the phenotype caused by replacement of the ZRS with a nonfunctional control sequence of similar length (Fig. 1e and Extended Data Fig. 2c)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Medium-range enhancers cannot act at long range
main_content: all four enhancers lack long-range activity and cannot support Shh-mediated limb development
context: despite the presence of bona fide enhancer features capable of driving strong limb gene expression in the context of a transgene
outcome: These results indicate that... all four enhancers lack long-range activity and cannot support Shh-mediated limb development

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Transplanted enhancers are accessible
main_content: To test whether enhancers maintain their endogenous chromatin architecture at a remote ectopic location
context: It is possible that silencing of the inserted region or failure of the insertions to create an open chromatin environment explains the inability of transplanted regions to act as long-range enhancers (Ref: 34,35)
outcome: we performed ATAC–seq experiments in ZPA region of forelimb and hindlimb buds of E11.5 mice heterozygous for the ZRSHS72 and ZRSHS1516 KI alleles

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Transplanted enhancers are accessible
main_content: Allele-specific ATAC–seq profiles demonstrated that both transplanted enhancers and orthologous mouse enhancers had an accessible open chromatin architecture (Fig. 2a)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: Transplanted enhancers are accessible
main_content: the heterologous HS72 and HS1516 limb enhancers were accessible when transplanted, but were unable to activate gene expression remotely
outcome: further supporting the idea that their inability to activate the Shh promoter in ZRS-replacement experiments is due to limitations in their genomic interaction range

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: The HS72 enhancer activates Shh at short range
main_content: To test whether E–P incompatibility (Ref: 36,37) could have a role in the observed differences in gene activation
outcome: we placed the HS72 enhancer upstream of the mouse Shh promoter and the LacZ reporter gene and injected the resulting construct into fertilized mouse eggs

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: The HS72 enhancer activates Shh at short range
main_content: All transgenic mouse embryos (7 out of 7) displayed strong LacZ expression in the limb buds, which was identical to HS72’s activity with the hsp68 promoter
outcome: indicating that the HS72 enhancer is fully capable of activating the Shh promoter (Figs. 1a and 2b)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: The HS72 enhancer activates Shh at short range
main_content: To test whether the HS72 enhancer can activate gene expression at the endogenous Shh locus
outcome: we generated a KI line in which the HS72 enhancer sequence was inserted around 2 kb upstream of the endogenous Shh promoter (Fig. 2c and Extended Data Fig. 4c,d)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: The HS72 enhancer activates Shh at short range
main_content: ShhHS72(+2kb)/WT mice had polydactylous forelimbs and hindlimbs and de novo Shh expression in anterior hindlimb buds
context: consistent with the HS72 enhancer driving expanded Shh activity (Ref: 42) (Fig. 2c and Extended Data Fig. 4b)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: The HS72 enhancer activates Shh at short range
main_content: ZRSHS72/WT mice had normal limbs
outcome: indicating the absence of broad HS72-mediated Shh activation from a remote position (Extended Data Fig. 2d)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: The HS72 enhancer activates Shh at short range
main_content: the HS72 enhancer can activate the Shh promoter at short range in its native endogenous context and in the context of a transgene
outcome: Together, these results show that the HS72 enhancer can activate the Shh promoter at short range in its native endogenous context and in the context of a transgene

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: REX is required for long-range activation
main_content: To explore possible missing factors in long-distance activation
context: the HS72, MM1564, HS1516 and MM1492 enhancers lie closer to their putative target genes than the ZRS (Fig. 1c)
outcome: we examined the genomic region proximal to the HS72 enhancer, which has the longest native activity range among four heterologous enhancers at 411 kb away from the Sall1 promoter (Fig. 1c)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: REX is required for long-range activation
main_content: We identified a highly conserved block of sequence located adjacent to the HS72 enhancer (Fig. 3a)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: REX is required for long-range activation
main_content: To test this hypothesis
context: owing to its strong conservation and position, we hypothesized that this sequence might support enhancer activity, including the ability to activate gene expression over remote distances
outcome: we generated KI mice in which the ZRS was replaced with an extended version of the HS72 enhancer that included this highly conserved upstream sequence (Fig. 3b)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: REX is required for long-range activation
main_content: addition of this uncharacterized sequence, which we termed the REX element, to the transplanted HS72 enhancer was sufficient to initiate Shh expression in the limb and resulted in full limb outgrowth with formation of all distal limb elements including fully formed zeugopod and autopod in ZRSHS72+REX/HS72+REX mice (Fig. 3b and Extended Data Fig. 5a)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: REX is required for long-range activation
main_content: ZRSHS72+REX/HS72+REX mice also displayed polydactyly on both forelimbs and hindlimbs
context: consistent with ectopic Shh expression in limb buds driven by broader HS72 enhancer activity (Figs. 1b and 2b,c and Extended Data Fig. 5a–c)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: REX is required for long-range activation
main_content: When placed upstream of the minimal promoter in a transgene, it is unable to drive LacZ reporter expression in transgenic mouse embryos (Fig. 3c)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: REX is required for long-range activation
main_content: the REX element does not have enhancer activity on its own but is required for long-range heterologous enhancer activation at the Shh locus
outcome: Together, these results indicate that the REX element does not have enhancer activity on its own but is required for long-range heterologous enhancer activation at the Shh locus

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: REX is sufficient for long-range activation
main_content: To test whether the REX element can extend the range of heterologous short-range enhancers
outcome: we generated a KI mouse line in which the ZRS was replaced with a chimeric element consisting of the shortest-range heterologous limb enhancer from our test set (MM1492, 73 kb native E—P range) appended by the REX element (MM1492 + REX; Extended Data Fig. 5d)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: REX is sufficient for long-range activation
main_content: KI of this chimeric element was sufficient to induce Shh expression in the limb bud and resulted in a fully developed zeugopod and autopod in the ZRSMM1492+REX/MM1492+REX mice (Fig. 3d and Extended Data Fig. 5e)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: REX is sufficient for long-range activation
main_content: These mice also displayed polydactyly
context: consistent with broad limb activity of MM1492
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: REX is sufficient for long-range activation
main_content: combining a short-range enhancer with the REX element and placing them at an ectopic remote location is sufficient to induce long-range gene activation
outcome: Taken together, these experiments show that combining a short-range enhancer with the REX element and placing them at an ectopic remote location is sufficient to induce long-range gene activation

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for REX activity
main_content: To identify specific TFs that may be involved in REX-mediated long-range enhancer action
outcome: we examined potential TF-binding sites within the REX element

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for REX activity
main_content: The REX element lacks CTCF and YY1 motifs and is not bound by CTCF in embryonic limb buds (Extended Data Fig. 6j)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for REX activity
main_content: identified conserved motifs of which the sequences matched binding preferences for LHX2 and LHX9 homeodomain (HD) TFs as well as LEF1 (Fig. 4a and Extended Data Fig. 6a)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for REX activity
main_content: To determine the importance of LHX and LEF1 motifs for REX function
outcome: we generated two KI mice in which the ZRS was replaced with the extended HS72 sequence containing the REX element with either the single LEF1 motif or both LHX motifs mutagenized

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for REX activity
main_content: Mice containing the REX element with mutated LEF1 motif showed fully developed limbs with polydactyly
outcome: indicating that disruption of the LEF1 motif does not abolish long-range activity of the REX element (Fig. 4b)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for REX activity
main_content: disrupting both LHX motifs resulted in mice with truncated limbs
outcome: indicative of a loss of Shh expression in the limb bud (Fig. 4c and Extended Data Fig. 6b)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for REX activity
main_content: the LHX motifs in the REX element are required for its ability to facilitate long-range enhancer activity at Shh locus
outcome: Together, these results demonstrate that the LHX motifs in the REX element are required for its ability to facilitate long-range enhancer activity at Shh locus

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are enriched in remote enhancers
main_content: To investigate whether the LHX or other TF motifs are present at long-range limb enhancers
outcome: we used a collection of experimentally validated limb enhancers from the VISTA Enhancer Browser

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are enriched in remote enhancers
main_content: (missing)
outcome: We linked these bona fide limb enhancers to their putative target genes using the correlation between gene expression and open chromatin peaks from our single-cell ATAC–seq (scATAC–seq) and scRNA-seq experiment or E–P physical interactions from enhancer-capture Hi-C experiments (Extended Data Fig. 1d)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are enriched in remote enhancers
main_content: (missing)
outcome: We next performed motif analysis of these limb enhancers

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are enriched in remote enhancers
main_content: We found 33 motifs... significantly enriched in long-range acting (173 regions; E–P distance, 400 kb to 2 Mb) compared to short-range acting (28 regions; E–P distance, 10–200 kb) enhancer regions (false-discovery-rate-adjusted P < 1 × 10−2 and target frequency > 30%), with LHX2 and LHX9 being among the most significantly enriched (Fig. 4d, Extended Data Fig. 6d,e and Supplementary Table 2)
context: match the binding preferences of limb-expressed TFs
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are enriched in remote enhancers
main_content: Overall, HD TFs with a similar [C/T]AATTA consensus binding preference, including DLX5, MSX2 and SHOX2, comprised 10 out of these 33 motifs
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are enriched in remote enhancers
main_content: short-range limb enhancers showed no enrichment for TF motifs over long-range enhancers
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are enriched in remote enhancers
main_content: (missing)
outcome: We next examined all 19,276 limb mesenchyme E–P pairs predicted from our scATAC–seq/scRNA-seq experiment (Extended Data Fig. 6c and Supplementary Table 2)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are enriched in remote enhancers
main_content: Genome wide, the LHX2 motif was among the most significantly enriched in long-range versus short-range limb enhancers (CTAATTA, P < 6 × 10−32)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are enriched in remote enhancers
main_content: Overall, [C/T]AATTA HD motifs, including both LHX2 and LHX9 motifs, comprised 15 out of the top 20 most significantly enriched motifs in long-range limb enhancers
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are enriched in remote enhancers
main_content: To test whether having more than one [C/T] AATTA motif could be characteristic of other long-range enhancers
context: The REX element contains two conserved LHX [C/T]AATTA motifs located within 30 bp from each other that are required for long range enhancer activity (Fig. 4a,c)
outcome: we examined the number of [C/T]AATTA motifs in experimentally validated and multiome-predicted limb enhancers (Methods)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are enriched in remote enhancers
main_content: for limb enhancers containing more than one [C/T]AATTA motif the enhancer regions were on average 429 kb farther (median distance) from their target promoters than other limb enhancers (P < 0.01; Fig. 4e and Extended Data Fig. 6f–i)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are enriched in remote enhancers
main_content: conserved [C/T]AATTA HD motifs are enriched in long-distance limb enhancers throughout the genome and are frequently located within the conserved core of enhancers themselves (Extended Data Fig. 6k)
outcome: Taken together, these results indicate that conserved [C/T]AATTA HD motifs are enriched in long-distance limb enhancers throughout the genome and are frequently located within the conserved core of enhancers themselves (Extended Data Fig. 6k)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for ZRS activity
main_content: The ZRS enhancer region contains four previously uncharacterized [C/T] AATTA motifs, three of which are located within the conserved core and are evolutionary conserved across all jawed vertebrates (Fig. 5a)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for ZRS activity
main_content: To test their requirement for spatiotemporal limb-specific ZRS activity
context: using dual-enSERT, our recently developed dual-fluorescence reporter system that enables comparison of enhancer allele activities in the same mouse (Ref: 44)
outcome: We generated a construct in which a WT approximately 1.3 kb mouse ZRS drives mCherry and the same ZRS allele but with mutated [C/T]AATTA HD motifs (ZRSΔHD), drives eGFP

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for ZRS activity
main_content: (missing)
outcome: We injected the resulting ZRS–mCherry/ZRSΔHD–eGFP bicistronic construct into mouse zygotes and collected transgenic embryos at E11.5

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for ZRS activity
main_content: We detected mCherry and eGFP fluorescence in the ZPA
outcome: indicating that the ZRS enhancer lacking [C/T]AATTA motifs can act over short range and drive robust reporter expression (Fig. 5b,c and Extended Data Fig. 7c,d)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for ZRS activity
main_content: We obtained a similar result when we swapped fluorescent reporter genes
outcome: ruling out the influence of fluorophores on our observations (Fig. 5c)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for ZRS activity
main_content: ZRSΔHD showed lower, albeit not statistically significant, quantitative activity than the ZRS regardless of the fluorescent reporter pairing
context: This may be due to the close proximity of [C/T]AATTA HD motifs to the ETS sites, which are critical for ZRS activity (Ref: 45)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for ZRS activity
main_content: we observed only mCherry expression and no detectable eGFP expression in transgenic mice lacking enhancer upstream of the eGFP
outcome: indicating that there is no reporter cross-activation (P < 0.0182; Fig. 5c and Extended Data Fig. 7b)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for ZRS activity
main_content: we examined whether these motifs are required for long-distance E–P communication
context: Having established that disruption of [C/T]AATTA motifs does not abolish limb enhancer activity in a reporter assay
outcome: We created a KI mouse line in which we disrupted the same three [C/T] AATTA motifs within the endogenous ZRS enhancer region

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for ZRS activity
main_content: disrupting the [C/T]AATTA motifs alone resulted in a loss of limb outgrowth indistinguishable from complete loss of SHH function in the limb
context: consistent with the specific requirement of [C/T]AATTA motifs for long-range ZRS activity (Figs. 1d and 5d)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for ZRS activity
main_content: The loss of limb outgrowth in ZRS∆HD/∆HD mice could be almost completely rescued by addition of the REX element; mice containing the ZRSΔHD allele fused to the REX element fully developed zeugopod and part of the autopod with four digits on both forelimbs and hindlimbs (Fig. 5e)
outcome: (missing)

title: Range extender mediates long-distance enhancer activity
subsection: LHX motifs are critical for ZRS activity
main_content: [C/T] AATTA HD motifs in the ZRS are dispensable for limb-specific activity at short range, but are critically required for long-range activity... [and] loss of long-range enhancer activity after the removal of endogenous [C/T] AATTA HD motifs could be compensated by addition of a heterologous REX element
outcome: Taken together, our KI and transgenic results indicate that [C/T] AATTA HD motifs in the ZRS are dispensable for limb-specific activity at short range, but are critically required for long-range activity... [and] demonstrating that the [C/T]AATTA HD motifs found in the REX element and the ZRS are functionally equivalent
